page.title: 11 Manor farm at Padbury
page.content: The manor belongs to All Souls Collage, Oxford.It dates from 1486.Rent is paid at michaelmas Sep 29,and on Lady Day March 25. The James family have farmed here since 1886 when a great uncle came from Wales.He was a cow dealer. Mr James is mainly a sheep farmer. He has 400 ewes called mules which are a cross between a swaledale & black faced leicesters. The ram is a Suffolk.The ewes have brown and white faces and long straggly wool. The sheep eat grass out side for most of the year but go inside 2weeks before lambing.They are also given hay, barley grain and fish meal concentrates. The ram goes with the sheep in july. Lambs are born at the end of December.Every year on average, 1.5 lambs each. Lambs sold at West Bromwich.Fleeces go to wool staplers at Thame,2-3 pounds each.
